results.title: To forget Venice = Dimenticare Venezia
results.creator_credit: Franco Busati, Ennio DiMeo, Vivien Boder, Action Films and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: An old country house in Venice is inhabited by four women: Aunt Martha (Eleonora Giorgi), a widowed one-time opera singer; Anna, her adopted niece (Mariangela Melato); Claudia, a school teacher and Caterina, an elderly servant. One weekend they receive a visit from Nicky (Erland Josephson), Aunt Martha’s brother who lived there as a child, and his friend Picchio. A collision of characters takes place with frailty, immaturity and rejection all surfacing at once. The death of Aunt Martha provides the catalyst for each individual to re-evaluate themselves and consequently provide the incentive to forget the past and start a new life. In Italian with English sub-titles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franco Busati, Ennio DiMeo, Vivien Boder, Action Films and Rizzoli Film

results.title: Alfredo Alfredo
results.creator_credit: Pietro Germi, Gugliemo Colonna and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: Alfredo Alfredo is a side-splitting comedy about the trials and tribulations of marriage. Alfredo Sbisa (Dustin Hoffman) is a shy young bank clerk who stumbles into a relationship with the girl of his dreams, Maria Rosa. His dreams take on a surreal tone as he is drawn deeper into a relationship with her. Who is this infathomable woman he has married? Alfredo starts to dream of an escape. Pietro Germi cleverly uses Hoffman’s gift for physical comedy, minimising his dialogue (which is dubbed by Ferruccio Amendola). In Italian with english subtitles.

results.title: Don Bosco
results.creator_credit: Leandro Castellani, Alfio Sugaroni and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: Born a peasant in Turin, Don Bosco (Ben Gazzara) has always known his vocation, thanks to an extremely significant dream. He welcomes poor, abandoned boys to his oratory and promptly teaches them to be charitable in accordance with the Christian doctrine. His power to sway souls away from the perils of greed and avarice frightens many people who repeatedly try to stop him, but without success. Self-assured, Don Bosco decides to found a congregation with its own rules but still has to contend with pressure from the Arch-Bishop of Turin.

results.title: Summer with Monika = Sommaren med Monika
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: When Harry (Lars Ekborg) meets Monika (Harriet Andersson) in a cafe they soon fall in love. Monika leaves home after an argument with her father and the young lovers run away on Harry’s father’s boat. They spend a carefree summer on the boat until Monika discovers she is pregnant and they are forced to return to Stockholm. As a married couple struggling to make a living Harry and Monika soon find their love disintegrating. Once again, Ingmar Bergman totally engrosses us in this sensitive study of young love, eliciting great performances from Lars Ekborg as the ernest Harry and Harriet Andersson as the wild and willful Monika. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Summer interlude = Sommarlek
results.brief_description: Summer interlude is Bergman’s poignant and lyrical study of young love. A young ballerina, Mari, falls in love with a fellow student (Henrik) and thy spend an idyllic summer together on an island near Stockholm where Mari lives unhappily with her uncle and his mistress. But the affair comes to a sudden and tragic end when Henrik is killed in an accident. Several years pass and Mari is now a prima ballerina, but still devastated and heartbroken by the loss. Bitter and without emotion she meets a young journalist, David) who has found the diary she wrote while Henrik was alive. The diary reawakens long dormant feelings and she gradually accepts David’s company and sets out to find a new happiness. This is Bergman’s first mature film and is a peotic evocation of the burden of memory and loss. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Magician
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: A 19th century hypnotist, Dr Vogler (Max Von Sydow), and his wife Manda (Ingrid Thulin), dressed as a man are scrutinised and ridiculed by Dr Vergerus (Gunnar Bjornstrand) due to sceptisicm towards their “magic” performance. Vogler seeks retribution for this humiliation by performing the greatest conjuring trick of them all- faking his own death. Vogler’s actions lead to the murder of a local constable who later returns to haunt the dead. Described as “a thinking man’s horror movie”, this film was awarded Special Jury and Cinema Nuovo Prizes at the Venice Film Festival, 1959. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Winter light = Nattvardsgarterna
results.brief_description: The second film in his trilogy on faith, “Winter light” springs from Bergman’s desire to define Man’s relation to God - if He exists. A village pastor, unloved and empty of faith, reveals his bitter failure to offer spiritual consolation to his flock. Sombre and poignant, the film sketches a world of half-empty churches - but a world not entirely without hope in God’s universe. The story brings together four personalities in a shared quest for siritual reassurance. A susceptible and disillusioned fisherman (Max von Sydow) is urged by his wife (Gunnel Lindboim) to seek solace from his local priest (Gunnar Bjornstrand). However the priest is struggling to regain his own belief - a tragic and intimately depicted conflict, in which he is eventually supported by the cynical resilience of the local schoolmistress (Ingrid Thulin). Swedish language with English subtitles.

results.title: Wild strawberries
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: Wild Strawberries is justifiably considered a classic Ingmar Bergman film. Isak Borg (Victor Sjostrom) is 78 and about to be honoured by the University of Lund for his services to medicine. He decides to drive to Lund with his daughter-in-law Marianne (Ingrid Thulin). The film follows the events of the day as he remembers scenes from the past, has bouts of troubling dreams, and meets up with a group of young travellers. Victor Sjostrom is marvelous as the rigid professor who is touched by the warmth of the people who he encounters on this pivotal day. This edition comes with Ingmar Bergman’s screenplay, which gives a fascinating insight into Bergman’s narrative skills, and includes a run-down of the cutting continuity for those interested in the techniques of film-making. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Smiles of a summer night
results.brief_description: This film marked a milestone in Bergman’s career and his success with international audiences allowed him this foray into romantic comedy. Forming the basis for Stephen Sondheim’s musical ‘ A Little night music’, this is the story of a middle-aged lawyer, his inexperienced young wife and her step-so, who are all invited to spend the weekend at the country mansion of a beautiful actress, the lawyer’s ex-mistress. During the course of the weekend three couples meet, exchange partners and provide some lively comedic action, illustrating Bergman’s sardonic attitude towards the vagaries of love. Behind the scintillating and witty approach to this charming period comedy of manners lie the illusions and pretensions of the haute bourgeois which Bergman cleverly illistrates with his collection of fickle husbands and scheming women.

results.title: Images: my life in film (Text)
results.brief_description: This book was written by Ingmar Bergman. To write it he rescreened all of his films, many not seen since their release. He recounts the making of the films and explores the themes that bind them together, the preoccupations, the anguish, the conflicts. He comments unsurprisingly on his successes as well as his perceived failures. This text is an eloquent and indispensable companion to Bergman’s films.
